response:
Combination of a pupil-involving right oculomotor palsy with severe ptosis, contralateral (left) spastic hemiparesis and hyperreflexia, contralateral limb ataxia, impaired joint position/vibration sense, positive Romberg and vertical downbeat nystagmus is best explained by a single focal lesion in the right paramedian midbrain tegmentum, where oculomotor fascicles run adjacent to the cerebral peduncle, red nucleus/superior cerebellar peduncle and medial lemniscus.

lesion_locations = ["right midbrain tegmentum"]
